result.execSummary:
The defendant William T Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 6/2/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 12 days served; Release only to the Day Reporting Center.  Eligible for goodtime release.  Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William T Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order denying request for release on electronic monitoring, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carl Ashley, Br. 33, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.


Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Patrick F.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 12 days served; Release only to the Day Reporting Center.  Eligible for goodtime release.  Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 6/2/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant William T Reed in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant William T Reed in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court vacates the warrant.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Court issued a warrant on 10/31/2014.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 6/1/2015, in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Discharge Summary, received and filed. lms

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court orders the stay lifted on a Bench Warrant issued 10-28-2014.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.  NO BAIL FORFEITED AT THIS TIME.

Defendant William T Reed in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 6.  Calendar call scheduled for 10-31-2014 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant William T Reed in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is having trouble maintaining sobriety.  Defendant has attended all JusticePoint appointment.  Defendant needs to complete community service and verify employment.  Review hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.lms

Defendant William T Reed in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has attending 9 of 12 appointments.  Defendant to begin counseling at UCC.  Defendant has an appointment with Habitat for Humanity to begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant William T Reed in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 8/12/14 at 8:30 am.  aw  Review hearing scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant William T Reed in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Danielle Chojnacki for Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/5/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant William T Reed in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
